abstract.p: Credit Agricole reports 12 percent increase in first-half operating income, to 3 billion euros, or $2.5 billion; net income rose almost 22 percent, to 1.4 billion euros (S)

block.p: The largest French bank by assets, Credit Agricole, reported a 12 percent increase in first-half operating income, to 3 billion euros, or $2.5 billion, buoyed by its investment banking and asset management businesses. Credit Agricole, which is owned by and serves regional French savings banks, said net income rose almost 22 percent, to 1.4 billion euros. Big, publicly traded banks in France have reported similarly strong results. Credit Agricole has said it intends to apply for a stock market listing.

The largest French bank by assets, Credit Agricole, reported a 12 percent increase in first-half operating income, to 3 billion euros, or $2.5 billion, buoyed by its investment banking and asset management businesses. Credit Agricole, which is owned by and serves regional French savings banks, said net income rose almost 22 percent, to 1.4 billion euros. Big, publicly traded banks in France have reported similarly strong results. Credit Agricole has said it intends to apply for a stock market listing.
